headline: Great place to work
pros: I'm extremely proud to be part of a company that is relevant more than ever in a post-COVID world, enabling secure work from home models to keep our economy going.  Our leadership has invested heavily in all the things we need to be successful: world-class enablement and sales tools, expanded partnerships and localized marketing.  I wake up every day excited to be part of a hyper-growth company.
cons: Zscaler is going through its own transformation internally, which allows everyone to contribute to new ideas and creative problem solving.  We are growing fast so preserving culture and focus is critical.

headline: Solid company with high focus on customer success
pros: 1. Everything is about customer success.  2. Problems we fix are big and hairy.  3. Exec team "walk's the walk".  Not just hot air.
cons: 1. 100% focus on customer means it can get intense and hours long.  2. Growing fast so if a person doesn't have a track record of succesfull self-management then they can get overwhelmed.

headline: Exciting cloud security company
pros: Amazing technology, great culture, fast-paced work environment.  Everyone is supportive and wants to help you succeed.
cons: No cons-work hard and you can be successful

headline: Great, growing company
pros: Lots of opportunity, best-in-class solution, solid sales management team, strong corporate vision.
cons: Very much in a transition phase! (But even that I see as a good thing, as there is lots of opportunity for growth/impact.)

headline: First time that I love totally what I am doing
pros: I appreciate the Team, Solution , the Roadmap and Vision & Salary
cons: When not being used to work independently from Home, you will miss the office

headline: Powering the Digital Transformation within organizations
pros:
- outstanding solution that has a true impact 
- opportunity to grow as a professional
- fantastic people & culture
- competitive salary
- great outlook to be part of something bigger
cons: I have no negative feedback on this organization

headline: Amazing support and sales enablement
pros: Tons of resources at work to make sure that we're conveying a valuable message.  Market share leader in what is becoming one of the most relevant components of IT strategy.  Leadership supports and empowers.  Constant continuous learning
cons: so much information coming in on a daily basis, if you don't have a plan and stick to it you can spend half of your day combing through the amount of resources that available

headline: All 3 P's
pros: Zscaler has all 3 P's - Product, People, and Process.  The product just works and its allows customers to have a great balance of Security and Customer Experience.  The people are always willing to help and leadership has a great vision.  With our new leadership on the sales side we have a great process in place to maximize our efforts and to enable us to partner with our customers.
cons: Nothing yet...happiest I am been as an employer

headline: Great place to work!
pros: Awesome technology and great leadership.  Zscaler is the leading provider of SASE. Enterprise sized companies are interested in cloud transformation and Zscaler is able to help with this. In the short period of time that I've been here we've engaged with over a dozen companies all with well known brands. It's a great time to be here.
cons: Systems and processes in flux. The company went public not to long ago and there is some transition towards new processes and systems. This will get better over time but for now we're at the "in between" stage.

headline: Great tech, great team, great leadership
pros: Even though it's a publicly-traded company, it still feels very much like a start-up. The culture here is all about making sure we do what's best for the customer, working hard to achieve goals, coming up with creative ideas, and having fun with your teammates. The technology is great, it really works, and I'm happy to be part of this ride we're on. Reminds me a lot of another great tech company, back when its culture was strong and innovation was at its peak. I'm looking forward to seeing what the leadership has to bring in the coming months.
cons: Sometimes it can feel a bit overwhelming with the number of projects and fast-paced nature of the deadlines, but that's to be expected when the company makes a strong shift towards a better direction. Not really a complaint, but more of an observation

headline: Horribly Culture, Misleading Marketing and Product Sales Strategy
pros: Base way was decently competitive, benefits were ok.
cons:
CEO is far too involved in everything and has no trust in any employees. Believes the product is so easy and sells itself that sales staff are treated like they don't matter.

They keep hiring sales people and reducing territories, no one can make quota long term. Place is like a revolving door of people leaving or getting let go.

A lot of misleading marketing about products.

Culture is horrible, CEO's brother in law is in charge of your travel and will put you in a lousy hotel to save $5 or have you on flights with connections.

headline: the waste company, Please don't join
pros: Nothing, just nothing, one more time NOTHING
cons:
Don't know from where should I start

1. Traning -->   0
2. support from seniors  --->  0
3. Higher Management  --> 0; only concerns about numbers while making loads of money sitting in the US from shares.
4. Employee growth  ---> 0
6. No process 
They don't give one proper training on product and expect you to deliver google search engine code. Seniors keep product knowledge to themselves. dnt know why ?  i wonder is this a product company or service company where you guys trying to save your position.   Highly disappointed.   ... At last, you start banging your head on the table and regret why you joined this waste company...

headline: High growth. Good people. Great product.
pros: The market is coming to Zscaler as more enterprises shift to the cloud. Company is well positioned to take advantage. Great team of caring, smart people that I continue to be friends with. Exec leadership is top notch.
cons: Hiring at a rapid clip. The challenge will be whether the culture can continue or will it get obliterated by new folks coming in.

headline: A great company with a bright future
pros:
- Challenging environment striving to become better each day
- Great leadership enabling new career opportunities
- Awesome technology helping customers get ready for a digital world
cons:
- Lot of change happening which is not a bad thing but needs employees to adopt
- Sometimes Customers struggle to adopt the full potential of the solutions due  to an old mindset

headline: Great company
pros:
Each day new learning.
Dynamic product easy to learn and deploy and far away from traditional network.
cons: All good sometimes lot of work.

headline: Solid vision, still working on culture
pros: Strong vision and positioned to be a technical market leader for the long term.
cons: Culture is still evolving but not yet in-line with peers

headline: My first 90 days at Zscaler
pros: Gives open and flexible environment, ample learning opportunities and exposure to world's best enterprise grade technology, leader in cloud security.
cons: Nothing encountered yet to mention here

headline: Great Place to Work!
pros:
The market is primed for what Zscaler has to offer and it's exciting to join a place that creates cutting-edge technology. Any company that is a disruptor is always exciting to be a part of especially when they are making the investment in top GTM talent and leadership. 

Everyone that works here is passionate about what they do and the excitement is contagious and pushes you to become better in your role every day.
cons: None that I can think of.

headline: An awesome place to work!
pros:
-Transparent, Flat Organisation with everyone able to reach everyone
-The CEO is a true visionary and a passionate leader
-The company follows "Employee First" culture
-The Product line is the most mature and established in the respective market segment
cons: -It has been good so far, i have none to mention.

headline: Growing pain
pros: Exciting technologies, inspiring CEO, good top-down communication
cons: Departmental silos. Dismal, inexperienced middle management in some areas.  Simple things (updating external web pages) involve months of cajoling and inter-departmental negotiations on deliverable timeline and processes.  New hire 90-day check-up from HR consists of a  5-minute meeting because she knows that she cannot exert change anyway.

headline: Going Places
pros: Great team, innovative technology, challenging, great pay, awesome management team, retire early when the stock hits $300!!!
cons: Growing pains, lots of new people who are still learning how to do their job

headline: Sales Roles are a Ticking Time Bomb
pros: The chance to work with high end network and security technology that is truly disruptive and transformative.
cons:
The management team tries to manage the small accounts and the large accounts to the same metrics and operational rhythms.  

Because you know - Fortune 100 buy exactly the same as a  100 person company.  

The solution is so difficult that ZScaler has built a hero cult of ‘closers.’ Most of the heroes show up and throw up the same slides and refuse to listen to the client.  

Marketing is so confused that they launch a new and totally different campaign every 2 weeks.

headline: Respectful work environment with knowledgeable and capable workforce.
pros: Company culture cultivates respect between all teams and coworkers. Plentiful resources for furthering individual education and technical skills. Employee feedback on internal processes, perks, and amenities is taken seriously and considered thoughtfully. Zscaler works hard to set you up for success as an individual in your career as well as a team player in the Zscaler family.
cons: There is still inner politics like at most tech companies. Sometimes work is stop-and-go when dependencies are in flux, which can make the workflow feel inconsistent.

headline: Great place to work
pros: Good environment, fair hours/work expectations, good people
cons: None so far! Still pretty new though

headline: Regional Director
pros:
The market opportunity is incredible! With the platform we have and the recent change in Sales Leadership, it feels as though we are unstoppable. Yes, there has been a lot of change in the last 6 months and there has been a lot of churn, but everyone now is very clear on why change was needed and understands what we have to do. For me personally, learning and starting to practice MEDDIC has been a game changer. 

I have recently been promoted into my role. I hadn’t been seeking promotion, but was offered the role based partly on my success at Zscaler. When I reflected on whether I wanted the role, I saw it as a once in a lifetime opportunity, given the coaching I can leverage from the new leadership.

We hire smart, hungry, ambitious people. You can tell this as soon as you walk in the office. There is a real buzz.  Working with people like this creates a great working atmosphere.
cons: Right now, I can’t think of any.

headline: Great place to work at
pros:
Good environment with challenging and fulfilling tasks assigned on regular basis
Flexible Timing
Great Top & Middle Management
cons: Great Place to work so far, No Cons observed as of yet.

headline: A once in a lifetime opportunity for someone with a growth mindset
pros:
Working here had already been life changing for me and now I've just secured my 3rd promotion in 3 years! 

There has been a lot of organisational change, which was initially unsettling. However, the dust has settled now and we're already a different animal. We've always educated the market well and had a unique and defensible value proposition. Now we've added a world class sales process that helps customers realise the full value of what we offer whilst mitigating our own business risk.  The coaching going on inside the sales organisation is of a very, very high standard. If you want to be the best sales professional you can be, then coming to Zscaler is a step in the right direction.  The new recruits have injected even more energy into what was already a motivated team. They've come here with the knowledge that there is limitless support and patience for those who commit to what we're trying to achieve. The execution and character shown in recent months is unlike anything I've seen before and we're already seeing the output of that.
cons: My original downsides with Zscaler have gone. The professional coaching was much needed. The new Enablement team and sales process has been a reinvigorating addition to the sales org. That was the obvious gap that's now been plugged.

headline: A place to grow and become the best professional you can be
pros:
I wanted to challenge some of the recent poor reviews posted by disgruntled ex-colleagues, despite most of them being friends of mine.

Due to the hyper growth we're experiencing, changes are inevitable. Until recently, we had no global sales process or methodology to work towards. Quite remarkable when you consider the growth we've managed to attain.

Our CEO went out to find the right people to take the business to the next stage of our development. This starts by finding the right CRO who can implement valuable change to continue our upwards trajectory. And we hired one of the best in the industry.

Some of the changes include; introduction of value-based selling methodology, MEDDIC framework and rigorous Pipeline Generation initiatives. All of these have brought immediate improvements to how we go to market and the results we are seeing. The disillusionment from previous employees comes from a negative reaction to change. Reps are now expected to own pipeline generation, rather than rely on inbound/marketing. The MEDDIC framework highlights gaps in the sales cycle and holds reps accountable for steps missed. And the value-based sales methodology requires a new way of thinking and communicating our value without relying on personal relationships. If the previous sales team stayed in Zscaler and adopted the new practices, I have no doubt they would be more successful. But not everyone is willing to do what they need to, to be the best version of themselves. That's all what is being asked.

The new KPIs mean that the previous average of less than 2 meetings per week per rep is unacceptable - which seems fair. And each rep needs to book a meeting to a new route of money per week - whether that be cross-sell/upsell/net new logo - with the amount of services and modules we have, this should be achievable.

The leaders truly care about development and the promotion path within the company has greatly improved in recent months.

If you're hungry for success, looking to be the best sales person you can be, make a load of money and have a load of fun - this is the place to be.

(Did I mention, our value proposition is second to none?)
cons: Uphill fight for salary review - may change with new leadership

headline: Endless Potential
pros:
I have been at Zscaler for 3+ years and seen the growth of our business.  Over that time, we have gone from a fast-growing gun slinging start-up, to the rigors of a quarterly driven public company.  With the shift to that new world order, companies need methodical and processes to succeed.  The days of gut feel need to be replaced with analytics and proven workflows.  What the new management have brought in is the rigor and predictability needed to maintain the aggressive ambitions of the company.  We can’t look back at what got us to this point, we need to (like a good software company) innovate.  This innovation is much like the evolution of life, from a child to an adult.  While now being an adult, doesn’t mean you can’t have fun and celebrate success.  In this transition I have seen a very positive step from a singular person winning, to the team celebrating victory!  We have set a goal and with the new team in place we will not just meet our targets, but crush them.

Pros:
•	“No man left behind” mentality
•	Endless Growth both professional and personally
•	Working with the best and brightest
•	A product that just works and fans that love us!
•	Strong Management with a vision
cons: All companies have warts, but the upside far outweighs those!

headline: Avoid Avoid Avoid!
pros:
If you want to be bullied, shouted at, belittled in front of your colleagues then this is the place for you. 

The Solution was ahead of its rivals but that edge has been eroded massivley and the growth that industry analysts have been told to expect wont be seen anytime soon! 

A Sales Management Team with a reputation in the IT industry for being arrogant, rude and so full of self importance that you would think they have found a cure for cancer has been parachuted in.
cons:
Too many to mention but account allocation being  weighted in favour of the new team to the point that deals that were due to close in weeks are taken away from people who did all the hard work and given to the newbies,  being told that you ahve to work evenings and weekends  are just two.

The people and culture team are just there to paper over the cracks and post "uplifting posts to Linkedin" which are totally at odds with what the culture is really like. They dont  want to listen to genuine concerns and are constantly asking staff to post great reviews on here to balnce the percentage of bad reviews with good, they do this from a few weeks into an emploee joining the company then management almost stand over them to ensure it follows the party line.
All of the longtime succesful salespeople bar two in the UK have left.

headline: Industry leading product and people
pros:
Industry: We’re a leader in an industry that’s growing year on year, Gartner are writing papers that look like they’ve come from our marketing department. 

Customers: some of the biggest in the world and growing 

Products: one of the products, if it was a stand alone business would be scaling towards a unicorn start up. 

People: the new leadership are proven, they know what they’re doing and the impact is now starting to show in the share price. There are A players in every department.

Sales enablement is taken seriously and everyone is trying to master their craft.
cons: Not a “con” per se, but our own HQ in London would improve on the WeWork, but that’s a minor.

headline: Research carefully.  This is a review for the UK team.
pros:
Scalable product that does exactly what it says on the tin. 
Customers are mostly happy.
cons:
I joined the UK team over a year ago as the original management team were excellent, but consequently they all left to be replaced ‘en masse’ by a team of relevantly inexperienced, arrogant, aggressive individuals whose management style is to belittle you instead of encouraging your personal growth.   
As far as I could gather they came in telling the CEO and Leadership team that they could drive revenue up exponentially and quickly.  This hasn’t been the case and their methodology is to bully, humiliate and disregard experienced professionals, driving a culture of fear and intimidation. 
They have successfully ‘managed out*’excellent people, to replace them with cheaper malleable recruits, whom they can manipulate into their ways.
*Managed out – with abusive behaviour, told pretty much you are useless, moved your earning accounts, and opportunities to the new ‘clone’ recruits.

Please search on the most recent and UK negative reviews here for the absolute truth to verify my statement.  They are reviews from colleagues.  

New recruits are very much encouraged to write reviews weeks after starting (with managers standing over them as they write them), as I was (but did not), so you find lovely glowing reviews.

If you are considering a role at Zscaler, then do your due diligence, look on LinkedIn for recent departees and reach out to them for their honest opinions.  Sadly not HR or the talent / recruiting team as their job is to cover the cracks.

If you join under this management team, then it is likely that your accounts and deals will be moved at a whim, to ‘manipulate’ the numbers for HQ, the game is for sales and targeted folk not to earn money.  
Despite reassurances about work/life balances you are expected to work every evening and weekends, so say goodbye to your personal life!  You will be expected to attend the office every Monday to make cold calls under supervision, even if you live in the Outer Hebrides!

headline: Working at Zscaler
pros: World wide operating company, but overseas colleagues are closely involved including the CEO. Great work atmosphere. Excellent managers with an eye for the human factor and best practices from around the globe.  Interesting work in a growing company with an innovative product that is seen by Gartner as the best of the best. Real opportunity to quickly progress within the company. A good work/life balance is sometimes tricky, but that is inherent to being a manager. Last but not least: good salary.
cons: No cons so far.

headline: Great People Focused Company with Open Communication

Tickets and good structure are preferred and trackable in most cases. However, collaborating and solving issues is best done directly without a "chain of command."
cons: For those working remote like me it can be more isolating, but active communication by Slack, web meeting, and email helps bridge the office social gap. Working with a truly global team, it can be challenging with timezones and schedules sometimes.

headline: Think twice before joining.
pros: Great Product with a good story behind it.
cons:
New management, right across the company,  who has been brought on wholesale from a non-aligned industry and has created a very unpleasant  'us and them' culture between existing staff and new staff.  

This new management is arrogant, unfriendly, they have a massive superiority complex (that will be their undoing) have no willingness to learn the product and actively tell new recruits NOT to learn the product. They have brought with them a new sales process that is being indoctrinated into the staff in a disturbingly cult-like manner.

An important point is, it doesn't matter whether you are dismissive or even only have reservations about the new sales process - you will not last in Zscaler. It is not hyperbolic to say, either you BELIEVE 100% in the new sales process completely or you are out. 

To be clear, this new asinine management isn't telling granny how to suck eggs, oh-no, they're telling chickens how to lay eggs. And the chickens aren't happy. If a chicken raises an objection, well, you can guess the rest... (Not many chickens would choose KFC as a career choice...)

This has resulted in a mass exodus of existing staff via either resignations or dismissals or demotions. People who have only been with the company less than a year have been treated with appalling contempt and an almost inhuman lack of respect. 

Anyone thinking of joining should seriously think twice before doing so.

New hires are pushed mercilessly and are actively forced to work unreasonable hours.  HR / People of Culture are AWOL basically acting like the Ministery of Propaganda and Social Media Damage Limitation. #Zscaler-Life

(Watch this post get buried)

In the past 5 Years, moral at Zscaler has always been low, but in the past 4 months, it has plumbed new depths.

Internal systems are shambolic, too.

headline: 4+ years in, still being challenged to get better!
pros: This company continues to grow and continues to invest in getting better.  New leadership is top notch and the focus is on growing revenue and customer bases without sacrificing the culture.  I cannot think of a time in my career where I have been surrounded by people willing to do their own job + more.  Fast paced, reward for risk, and ok with failure as long as you are willing to learn.  Humbled to be leading a team where my directs are often better than I am on the job.  This company has not lost its passion for leading edge tech, taking care of customers, and constantly educating everyone in how to dominate a marketplace.  Right time, right leadership, disruptive tech, and unlimited growth opportunities if you can handle them.
cons: Expectations are high and the pace is frenetic; still run like a start-up.  You must be agile, able to take criticism, and comfortable working within a bit of ambiguity at times.  This company expects you to take an idea or role and run it as if it were your own company.  Not for the weak and the pace does not let up.  If you need to be told what to do, this might not be the place for you.

headline: Still Great
pros: Been at Zscaler for 4 years and have not regretted the move.  This is turning out to be one of the top 2 places I've ever worked.  The employees are what make it a fantastic experience. You go home and feel good about not only what you accomplished, but how you accomplished the job.  It's still very much a start-up mentality with little to no politics, just good people focused on doing a great job without a lot of ego. However you want to measure success Zscaler has it - products, revenue, growth, disruptive technology, great place to work certification, and the list goes on.
cons: I've read the negative reviews on here and honestly, I have not had the same experience.  Sometimes makes me wonder if we work at the same company.   Zscaler is what you make of it and certainly isn't for everyone.  The pace is really fast and expectations are incredibly high.  You have to be able to thrive (not just cope) in a founder led environment without a guidebook to tell you what to do all the time.  Most of the cons I've experienced are growth related - having the tools and resources you need can be a challenge.

headline: Good technology supported by flawed organization with poor outlook
pros:
- the product is a good cloud platform. There are no competitors who can claim to do this and have the stats to match
- people who joined before the IPO got a great pay-out and the company benefits are gradually improving, like 401k matching, sick days.
cons:
- technology shifts made Zscaler and will break Zscaler. IPv6, DoH, TLS 1.3+  are all breaking platform functionality and increasing required workarounds
- recently announced features are lame-ducks on delivery - ZDX is to reduce support ticket CASB functionality is feature poor, not competitive
- Zscaler has technically smart people with zero understanding of effective enablement and a sales team which doesn't have any market understanding all the way through to having no basic IT skills
- training and marketing material is focused on creating and delivering a message for delivery by the Zscaler CEO and no one else. Even master decks look like from 2013 and as a mix tape of other decks
-  this is a poor foundation as product expands and new hires are started. Execution erodes while personalities with little output fill the void of those who are fired or move on to something better
- the IPO was successful and many employees lazy waiting for last heavily discounted ESPP payday
- there are few paths for progression in any part of the organization that don't require office politics

With a company that promise to Wall Street a 50% growth, the targets and strategy to reach this becomes absurd: Far too many Sales are deployed on a territory resulting in frustration when it comes to target achievement/personal accomplishment.
Some recent recruitment at Manager/Executive level that make me question the sanity of the people who hired them. Culture in the company seems to take the direction of bullying and harassment which was not the case before.
If you plan to make a career here, prepare to please the management and be very political. 
Depending where you'll be based you will be more or less exposed to this.
There's supposed to be a People and Culture team in the company, but except prompting you to post a Glassdoor review on your very 1st month (which explain the high ranking) they really don't do much to help with the bad atmosphere and well being of their employee.

headline: Excellent Place to Work - Changing How People Connect to Everything
pros: Zscaler is at the forefront of the current megashift towards the cloud - where people connect to applications rather than networks, and they do so over the internet. Management has been visionary now for eleven years, and show no sign of slowing down. New products complement old ones, and selling them is straightforward since basically everyone will need them in one form or another over the next five or more years. The competition is scrambling to catch up and are at least two years behind for even the best ones. My colleagues are always willing to go the extra mile, and the environment is as close to family as I want to get in the workplace. I fully expect this will be the place from which I retire in twenty years!
cons: Selling from a technical perspective is straightforward, but it takes a different type of salesperson seemingly as some of them are very successful and others tend to leave more quickly. Setting better expectations of the sales staff when hired would be useful.

headline: A life changing opportunity !
pros:
I have been working @Zscaler for 3 years and I love every single day. 
The solution fundamentally changes how companies secure access to applications. It is a real transformation platform. 
Many of the customers I work with say Zscaler is one of the unique company that is always present and provides value throughout their transformation journey. 
I really enjoy the open door communication with the leadership team and executives. Respect, innovation and passion are key values that resonate throughout the teams. 
Zscaler has a strong culture of promoting within.
Finally, in my 3 years I'm continuing to experience strong teamwork with top notch professionals.
cons: none that i can see

headline: Amazing Place to Work

- Constructive conflict / challenge is encouraged by leadership

cons:
- Job roles and expectations can be uncomfortably fluid. You frequently learn about tasks you are apparently responsible for

headline: The Devil Is In The Details - A Sales Perspective on ZS
pros:
You will work with some of the best and brightest technical minds and engineering talent in the industry.  Almost all of them, while absurdly overworked, are always willing to lend a hand and be helpful if it means closing business. I did not work with a single technical resource during my time that left a bad taste in my mouth. 

The technology genuinely works as advertised, and many large companies are taking advantage of the Zscaler cloud today, and will continue to do so. 

There is plenty of positive coverage of ZS now that the company is public. There are use cases and case studies abound, and many extremely credible companies that are willing to be references.

With large opportunities, there is an abundance of internal executive resources willing to help you close business, meet with prospects/customers, and bridge gaps needed for you to be successful.
cons:
While all of the above at a macro level rings true, like I said, the devil is in the details:

The company is a logistical nightmare internally. Many are brought on under the guise of a scope of responsibility, and then immediately handed twice that in work/responsibilities. One would intuitively think that calls for additional headcount, but the hiring process is far too long and cumbersome, and because of that, critical roles (new or existing) are left unfilled for months at a time.

Travel is still booked through a travel desk, even for upper management. You are not allowed to make any arrangements yourself without prior approval. Not the biggest deal in the world, but annoying nonetheless.

Training is mediocre at best. Fairly unorganized, goes off topic quickly, and leaves much to be desired in terms of understanding what is needed to successful within the role.

Now, before I get to this next point, I want to call out that many companies put out difficult KPI's to their sales reps, challenging quotas, etc. and sales reps tend to gripe about them regardless.  That said, the KPI's and quotas at Zscaler are not just challenging, they are wildly outlandish. Unless you cover large or major accounts, there is virtually zero chance you will hit your quota.  The overwhelming majority of reps here do not. When I say overwhelming majority, I mean >75%. I implore anyone interviewing for a sales role to ask the question: "How many of your reps hit their quota last fiscal year?" Knowing that, you can also deduce that whatever you're given as an OTE potential, you absolutely will not come close to it.

Work-Life Balance? Ha. Non-existent. I can personally attest to know multiple people working 60-70 hours a week, and still sending/receiving e-mails on Saturdays & Sundays. I have personally witnessed these same people get verbally berated for lack of performance.

Senior Management cares about one thing now: the share price. If your activity and sales do not demonstrably impact it in a major way, you are effectively ignored. While not the case for me, I know of others who had "mentors" appointed for them that were so busy and stressed trying to handle their own job, that newer hires were left to fend for themselves and figure things out on their own.

Look at the average tenure of a ZS employee. Doesn't that seem alarming to you? It shouldn't shock you that I know of at least a handful of employees who are literally counting the days until their stock fully vests so they can leave.

Overall, I can't say as though I regret my decision to join, or to leave. I learned plenty along the way, and also learned what red flags to look out for when considering a company.  I can unequivocally say I have never been more stressed at a job than I have working this one. Working at ZS is fantastic for you if you have the patience, time, and dedication to put in an insane amount of hours, and can handle being constantly micro-managed. Is it rewarding? Yes, in some cases. If you land in the right patch, or close the right deal. Will you sacrifice more than you think getting there? Absolutely. While not always the case across the board, it's also not by coincidence that many who do well here are single and/or don't have kids. 

For the rest of you, my advice is to look elsewhere.

headline: A Pretty Special Place
pros: While I’ve been at the company to see it grow from 500 to well over 1,000, something that remains the same is the strong culture of hardworking, friendly and genuine people that are always willing to help. We don’t have execs or leaders who are above doing something whether it means helping set up tables for an event or taking the extra time to explain something to a more entry level person. There is a strong sense of integrity here and from time to time our company values have gotten challenged, but in the end our leadership proves that we don’t just slap our values up on a website or a PowerPoint, we actually live by them.
cons: Some challenges are that processes aren’t always in place and aren’t always followed if they are in place, however, sometimes that’s the fun in working here - you get to make the process. Teams are open to new ideas and are willing to hear you out. One major con would be that there is a no work from home policy. There can be flexibility if you need to stay home for say something being delivered or someone coming to your house to fix something, but for the most part, teams are discouraged to WFH “just because”. Hopefully this will change over time.

headline: Sr.Manager, Technical Account Manager EMEA
author_position: Senior Manager, Technical Account Manager EMEA
pros:
•	Organization itself makes you feel comfortable and they have a culture of open Communication
•	Team that welcomes you and help you settle in the new organization 
•	Lot of opportunity to learn and grow 
•	good exposure for people who are willing to step up and perform

I have been with Zscaler a little over 3 months, prior to this, I was with Citrix for 6.5 yrs.
the initial phase is the most challenging for any individual joining a new organization and you are out of your comfort zone in unknown waters. I had similar thought process however; during my hiring phase my Hiring Manager had regular connect with me and made me comfortable and spent time to have that connect. 

Once I was on-boarded not for once I was got the feeling that I don’t belong here. The team and my counter parts in other GEO’s invested their time to walk me through on how process, product works at Zscaler. 

In simple words this was one of my best onboarding and initial phase experience I had in 16 yrs of my corporate life.
cons: Nothing i can think of

headline: The best professional experience I have had since 2008
pros:
- Focus on the result and not activity: I believe all organizations will sooner or later need to understand the importance of this principle. Not only does this give you the liberty to think out of the box, but it also improves productivity of the team.

- Flexibility to work from home (and to update your role once you realize what you like best): it somewhat chimes in with the first point about reporting being result-based but it's a game-changer for many people like me who'd rather avoid the transport time every day.

- Ultra-sharp vision: a product without a practical use case isn't a useful product. I have learned a lot from the product management team here in this regard.

- Open communication policy: everyone is actively encouraged to reach out to any team for any queries and it works really well with just a little bit of process. 

- Very accessible and innovative management: I have only seen successful adoption of strategic processes since I joined and I have always been able to get a prompt response from management for my queries.

- Passionately curious colleagues: last but not the least, never have I had the opportunity to work with teams that are so invariably eager to learn all the time. I believe this is what makes our teams so cohesive.
cons: Being a healthy critic, I was able to spot some but those disappeared after I reported them to my managers over all these years.

headline: Perfect Work/Life Balance at a Growing Tech Company
pros:
I came to Zscaler from a large computer networking company supporting customer with IT issues and immediately fell in love the place. Here are some of the reasons why - 

-Opportunity to leave a impact; Zscaler is a fast growing company into a growing market and there's always an opportunity to bring your ideas to the table and leave an impact 

-The product is relevant is constantly expanding and  always adding new features quickly with thorough QA. Engineering group  acts fast to handle hot issues 

-The culture is amazing. Everyone is friendly and willinging to help a lending hand, the variety  career backgrounds  which brings alot of knowledge to the table

-Nice work life balance, I don't need to be pinned to my desk for 8 hours and the company has flexible work from home policy
cons: There's some ambiguity to some processes

headline: Excellent place to work
pros:
I have been working at Zscaler for almost 3 years, as an engineer, in the San Jose headquarters.  Therefore, I can only speak to my experiences regarding the engineering side of the company.

This is an excellent place to work.  The engineering teams are incredibly dedicated and tight-knit.  People here work very hard, but more in the sense of wanting to do a great job and not letting your colleagues down, rather than because your boss is breathing down your neck.

There is an intense focus on doing what you have to do to keep our customers happy.

They treat you as an adult here.  You can have flexibility as far as "face time hours" in the office if you need it, but of course you are expected to get your work done regardless and behave responsibly.

This place is not for everyone.  If you're not that dedicated to your job, it's not for you.  If your attitude is "I work hard from 9am-6pm, but after that I shut it down and make it difficult for anyone to reach me," this place is not for you either.

But if you have the passion and the dedication, and enjoy working with like-minded engineers in a (mostly) bureaucracy-free environment, I strongly recommend this company.

Also, it's not all work and no play here.  There are plenty of celebrations and fun events (on-site and off-site), formal and informal gatherings in the break areas, once-a-week free lunches, endless free snacks and drinks, etc.  I think it's the right balance.
cons: I have heard that the pay is just average for the Valley.  But I cannot personally vouch for this, as I'm satisfied with my salary (no idea if I'm average or below-average) and don't know what others make either.

headline: Great Company for Challenging Rewarding Work
pros: Zscaler is not afraid to reward hard work that translates into successful outcomes in customer engagements. Excellent sales and technical leadership for transformational network and application access.

headline: The place you need to be !!
pros:
Product - Zscaler is built from scratch cloud security product. Only one of its kind in the IT cyber security market.
R&D - The product never gets old, zscaler invests heavily in the product and it sells like cakes. ZPA is the latest addition and is a revolutionary product  on its own.

Learning - There is so much to learn at Zscaler. If you have the right mindset and zeal to learn, there is no shortage of content at Zscaler.

Flexible Work environment - Balance between work and personal life.

Leadership team - pick up anyone from the senior leadership team, they all know what they are doing and have a clear vision to success.

Perks and Incentives - They are pretty good.

Open Door Policy - You can reach out to anyone for help, even to Jay.

Cross Functional engagement - This is something which is promoted a lot within the company, you can directly speak to product manager or engineering to get any help required.

Privileged - Working at Zscaler in a customer facing role is not hard from an engagement perspective.  The product is so strong that it opens doors for you and you would find yourself speaking to some top leaders in various customer verticals.
cons: Zscaler is growing and a lot of work is now being done to make policies consistent.

headline: Great Company, Great Benefits

Being Zscaler is recently public, the benefits with us continue to improve across the board. Not to mention they were good when I initially came on as well.

There are clear, defined paths to advancement as well as many different avenues you can take your career. 

We all share a universal site in which we can learn more about different aspects of the company/software to better define where we want to take our careers and expedite that process through our own continued education.

Zscaler provides the tools we need to succeed in this position, and there is continuous research into new tools that can help streamline our workload.
cons: The BDR team is fairly new and still experiencing growing pains, but this is temporary and we tend to improve our processes monthly.

headline: Making Customers successful through the Z power
pros:
People are willing to support and help each other, one person may not be able to help you but they will guide you to the right person or process to follow. 
No-one works in silos.
The atmosphere in the office is of joy and wanting to do exceptional things in your job.
CEO, Jay, is always willing to meet customers at whatever level to support the value of Zscaler and support the account team.
cons:
As it is still a relatively small company, there are still many unknown processes.
The product roadmap does not have clear timelines,  which impacts customers perception of the company and is hard to manage from a customer-facing role.
You need to find people who have been within Zscaler for a few years to know the "people to know to get the job done".
We are a bit demanding on our customers to get Zscaler deployed fast, without respecting the fact that Zscaler is still a small component of a customers environment and not as urgent as other larger impacting vendors.
The social events tend to be limited to specific groups rather than an entire company in a specific location.

headline: Innovative company with great products
pros: No politics, Market position, Innovative products, Good career opportunities, strong international presence
cons: Benefits ok but could be better. vacation rules in EMEA.

headline: Never been made to feel so insignificant
pros: An amazing technology that has the potential to  change the enterprise security market and that has competitors running scared.
cons: Upper management does not trust the people they hire. It makes for a very tightly controlled environment where employees are made to feel insignificant.

headline: Software engineer
pros: no politics. very good work culture. well positioned in the market to grow.
cons: No meditation room for the close to half a day that we spend in the office.

headline: Revolutionary Technology
pros:
-Great SE leadership and engineers. Strong bond/community amongst the team and very willing to help each other
-The technology is really ahead of it's time. Both the ZIA and ZPA platforms are the way of the future.
-Really good compensation and benefits
-Lots of opportunity to learn and work hard
cons:
-Difficult for many companies to understand this transformation as they want to keep doing what they're doing, even though there is a better way.
-Wish we could develop new features faster :)
-No 401k matching yet
-It can be a difficult sale if you only target a technical audience; it is definitely a platform requiring top-down selling  which is difficult for many reps to do

headline: Great company!
pros: It is wonderful company that has an amazing technology and a great team. The executive team have a great vision and it feels we are moving towards greater things.
cons: Zscaler is growing fast and the company should ensure that the supporting team grows with the same pace and within the region.

headline: Great place to work
pros: Most teams have flexible working hours. The office environment is great.
cons: Nothing that I can think of.

headline: Should be in top 5 best places to work!
pros: Everyone is willing to help.  Regardless of the situation, the entire company is behind you. Zscaler also has a fantastic work culture. You can speak your mind openly and it's encouraged.
cons: There is no downside to being here.

headline: Great technology with some growing pains
pros: Great technology and the platform just works. Very innovative and forward-thinking company.
cons: The team spirit could be higher. This is something management is currently working on so it should improve in the future.

headline: Still brilliant after over 2 years
pros: Good team and good atmosphere. Great solutions. Super access to execs.
cons: Sometimes still a little DIY

headline: New Hire
pros: excellent vision, passion and commitment from all executive leaders.  Those traits trickle down and is evident from all employees.
cons: marketing is being improved as the message is being diluted and copied by others who do not have the technology to copy.

headline: Great People, Fast moving
pros:
Able to be creative and get things done fast. 
The people are all driven and passionate.
cons: Long hours, it’s hard to disconnect but maybe it’s because I’m a workaholic and love what I do!

headline: Great Company
pros: Excellent culture which flows down from the upper management.   Good work/life balance.   The majority of people here are very passionate about their work and growing Zscaler's technology.   Teams collaborate well.   Weekly catered lunch for employees and usually 1-2 hosted social or volunteer events per month.
cons: Benefits are not very good.   Compensation seems low for some departments.

headline: The place to be
pros: energetic and open organisation who are in the transformational business. Very welcoming and approachable people with a can do / will do culture. great to be in an industry where clients want to work with you to a better end for them and Zscaler.
cons: Non as yet - and thats honest speaking.

headline: Field Marketing Manager
pros: Visionary leadership and great management team.  Extremely flexible work environment.  I appreciate the investment the company makes in continuous learning to make sure employees are well versed in Zscaler products.
cons: Very few cons.  Overall, Zscaler is one of the best companies I have ever worked for.

headline: Great first start to my career!
pros:
Having only been with Zscaler for just over 2 weeks, I am very much enjoying my time so far.
Being my first job as a recent graduate, the entire on-boarding process has been great and I the team make it very easy to make you feel comfortable. I have been given so much to get stuck into already and there is always somebody available to ask for help.
cons: Not that I can think of

headline: Regional Sales Manager at Zscaler
pros: For a growing company, I have always felt that everyone I've met at Zscaler is motivated and willing to help out.  There was plenty of information, both self paced or via a trainer, to help you understand the company and solutions.
cons: To this point, I don't feel like I've encountered any downsides to our organization.

headline: The place to be!
pros: Great teamwork! Everyone is very positive and ready to help each other at a moment's notice.  And the massive growth of the company means there's plenty of opportunities to grow with the company.
cons:
The amount of work can be intense sometimes as we are a high growth company,. 
 But if you enjoy what you are doing, this is manageable, and even fun.

headline: Principal Product Manager
pros: Amazing product and a huge opportunity for growth. Encouragement for right ideas. Recognition for best performance.  Passion and energy across all teams to solve the problem.
cons: Need more process in place to address the pace at which business is growing and increasing customer demands.

headline: A breath of fresh air!
pros:
Throughout the last year, I can see my team genuinely cares about my career and personal growth. Everyone strives for continuous improvement to keep up with the fast paced environment and I've experienced very little bureaucracy. 
Fun office perks, plenty of free food, events and team bonding
cons:
We need more females in leadership positions
Compensation is below average

headline: Zscaler - Bring your A Game
pros:
Minimal Politics/Do the Right Thing Mentality
Excellent/Supportive Leadership
Driven & Motivated Peers
Industry Changing Technology
Stringent Hiring Process
cons: Sales cycles often run longer than expected.  (more a caution than a con)

headline: Systems Engineer - Right platforms, right time, right company
pros: Zscaler's solutions help customers solve very real and timely problems. Company is still small enough to be laser focused on what it does well and it's incumbent hardware appliance competition is scrambling to change direction/pivot to cloud and catch up with where their customers are headed. Very supportive environment for systems engineers with a great team of knowledgeable folks who realize that success is a team sport.
cons: Takes quite a while for new SE's to come up to speed as ZIA and ZPA collapse 7-10 point products down to 2. Great benefit to Zscaler customer's but steep learning curve can be a challenge for new systems engineers.

headline: Field Marketing Manager
pros:
Colleagues are phenomenal to work with and collaborate with
Company encourages lots of team bonding both remotely and in local offices
Great women’s empowerment group
Salary is very competitive
cons: You get what you give so if you don't give you may not be happy

headline: Lead Development Representative
pros: I have been with Zscaler for a little over four years. It has been an incredible opportunity to see the company grow so dramatically over the last few years. Not only has the product and processes continually improved but the culture has stayed just as great as day one. From the amazing, inspiring, and humble CEO, to the People and Culture team, from marketing, to engineers and sales, I truly believe myself to be surrounded by people that care not only about the company, but also my individual growth and success. Zscaler is a wonderful place to work full of opportunity and advancement. I am blessed to a be a part of the Z-family.
cons: From time to time, there have been growing pains, but nothing that hasn't been more than worth it.

headline: Inside Sales Rep
pros: Great team environment. Supportive management that cares about individuals/team. Continuing to promote from within the company which boosts morale. World class product.
cons: Lots of organizational changes. Scaling has growing pains within company.

headline: Regional Sales Manager
pros: The leadership team is passionate and accessible to work with the the sales team, and that promotes a healthy culture as well.  Co-workers are also friendly and willing to dig in to get deals done.  Compensation is competitive for the industry with opportunities for major acceleration.  Large install base of customers is key to leveraging and opening new doors.  This is an excellent place to work and an exciting time to join Zscaler!!
cons: I cannot think of any cons to working at Zscaler at this time.

headline: Sales
pros: Good company culture and enjoying going to work every day
cons: have not seen any yet

headline: Solid Company
pros:
Great leadership
Great product
Great company culture
cons: One company lunch per week

headline: Scaling new heights everyday!
pros:
- Amazing, unparalleled product that is transforming security
- There is a huge potential for growth no matter which team you are in!
- Leadership is highly supportive of new ideas and enables us to go above and beyond our day to day roles.
cons: Can't think of any. The company is growing at an astounding pace and hiring talented people is our #1 priority.

headline: Just getting started
pros:
#1 culture. I drive to and from work with a smile on my face. Great work life balance.

#1 CEO - Jay is a trailblazer. 

Leadership in general - they work for us, not the other way around.
cons: There is a lot of rapid expansion at the moment so it's difficult to keep track of all the new faces.

headline: Great Product & Great Company
pros:
-Product is great, performs as advertised with customers
-Solves a legitimate problem, unlike a number of other Silicon Valley companies
-Great at supporting sales and pre-sales with a myriad of resources
-Smart people at all levels, which is rare
-Leadership has not lost touch with the problems our customers face day to day, which is extremely refreshing
-Maniacal focus on the customer
cons: -Sales rep density in the field increasing very rapidly and slow to hire SE's to support

headline: the amazing and great about Z-life
pros:
-Good opportunities to grow professionally.
-The opportunity to be in a company that is growing rapidly in the market.
-Good product and technology to sell.
-Many customer currently love the solution that give some loyalty for the post sale cycle.
-Management is doing a great effort for a fun environment within the office
cons:
- As it is a young company which is growing so fast, there is not structure for some departments or positions.
- 100% active on your emails to avoid escalations and ensure all your deals are closed on time (even during weekends and holidays).

headline: Fantastic Place (Great Environment and Great Product)
pros: I've been here for just over a year now and the energy and positivity that everyone has to the success of the business is infectious.  We have the right investment in sales engineering support, the product portfolio is constantly being innovated to keep us ahead of the industry, we aren't micromanaged and we are given the flexibility to sell how we like.
cons: I haven't seen any yet.

headline: Exciting technology and a great team spirit
pros:
- A real cloud - forget the hybrid hype, nothing compares to a real cloud solution
- Seriously interesting solutions that are more than security
- Real interest in fostering a close team spirit both within the Customer Success team and more broadly to the technical account managers
- Evolving processes that take team feedback into account
cons:
- If you're not comfortable with uncertainty you might not be happy with the lack of process or the rapidly-changing priorities. 
- Too many accounts to be able to spend a lot of time with each

headline: Sales Engineer
pros: The work environment is great with good colleagues and a great product
cons: At the moment, I cannot find any cons...

headline: Great place to work and be successful
pros:
Innovative technology which is supporting the customers on their way of digital transformation.
Highly experienced sales and engineers, going the extra mile.
Committed and experienced leadership team locally and globally.
cons: It's not a startup anymore. Processes got aligned with compliance requirements of a public company. This led to a loss of agility in the daily business.

headline: One of the best company to work for
pros: Company is full of highly self motivated and passionate people. The enthusiasm is contagious
cons: Negligible in front of  joy of working here

headline: Best company to learn
pros: Company provides you challenging opportunities to learn.
cons: No Cons I could find so far.

headline: Great Potential for Reward and Growth
pros:
Just celebrated 1-year anniversary. Great leadership and culture. Much less drama and cronyism than many previous start-up cultures. Very focused on results and building partnerships and annuities. Executive leadership is excellent across the board including sales leadership. Great diversity of talent and learning opportunities. Way above average hiring and people culture.

From a sales contributor perspective, comp plans remain very competitive despite market success and IPO success. Accountability is a key metric across sales and every other business unit.
cons: Business transformation sales are never easy and are often complex and lengthy.  Despite market and IPO success, Zscaler sales roles continue to require gritty determination to succeed. This is not a "con" but a caution.

headline: I have been working more then 1 year in Zscaler
pros: Work life balance, good compensation, good salary hikes, sports, mgmt is open to talk with employees
cons: ..............No Cons and good company to work

headline: Marketing
pros:
- great team
- you always get support and help if needed
-salary
cons: - work and life not coequal

headline: dynamic, exciting  and successful journey
pros:
positive atmosphere
correct attitude
forward thinking
open minded
cons: fast growing and the subsequent structural changes

headline: Customer Success Manager
pros: Great atmosphere, the agility of a startup without too much process. Nowhere is absolutely perfect, but it feels good working for Zscaler
cons: not the best benefits vs the market

headline: InfoSec - The Future is Here
pros:
Company is the leader in Security as a Service.
Built as a cloud service from inception - actual cloud platform and global footprint - not VM's sitting in AWS
Amazing technology - virtually all organic
Solid technology partnerships with key companies
cons:
Still work to do on the administrative side (travel, expense reports) - still operating like a small, private company
Still work to do on improving corp benefits (401k matching, etc)

headline: Best tech, born in the cloud, disruptive, just getting started...
pros: Amazing technology that solves the challenges of securing organizations in todays cloud first and mobile worlds. Starting with CEO down leadership always encourages open communication and feedback to make the company better and stronger. The people are best in the industry, talented, driven and collaborative, we win as a team.
cons: None at the moment, having fun

headline: Floating on Cloud Nine!
pros:
-Very open and diverse work environment
-Very fast-paced (my preferred style)
-Fast growing, but still feels like a small company/start-up vibe
-Office amenities include: fully stocked kitchens, catered breakfast on Mondays and lunch on Thursdays, lots of in-office get togethers and off-sites, etc
-CEO sits in cubicle near us and is very friendly/approachable. Feels very tight knit in office
-All in all I'm surrounded by very creative, open, and intelligent people.
cons: -Some people may not like the fast-paced environment depending on work-style preference.

headline: Regional Sales Manager
pros: Very exciting place to work.  Great technology, and great people.  The compensation plan is fantastic!!  Love working for Zscaler!!!
cons: It is a young company with some rough edges but nothing that would make it a negative

headline: Great vision & Leadership in a Startup Mindset!
pros:
Been working for Zscaler for less than one year in Paris, and Zscaler is one of those companies where you feel the people’s passion and desire to achieve the best outcome while focusing on providing the best user experience and add value to the their customers. it's without a doubt why Zscaler is the leader in this market.

The people are amazing, the atmosphere is great and the management is always listening, helping and assisting.

Paris office is in La Défense Area, A decent office where you have people from everywhere and every department, everyone is helping when you’re having an problem. Good energy and fascinating people.

If you love to challenge yourself in a multicultural environment and you’re are focused on customer success, and wanting to have a better work/personal life balance, Zscaler is the place to be.
cons: Nothing I can think of.

headline: Customer Success Manager
pros: Great, (and still startup like) place to work, fast growing with a great security cloud platform & business transformation plays that resonate very well with customers. Unique, nice and very motivated colleagues to work with. Little to no politics & bureaucracy and great managers/leadership team..
cons: nothing much, the company is growing very fast, so everybody has pick up some extra work on the side until people are hired..

headline: Very happy!
pros: Great people, fantastic technology, loyal customers and  world class leadership. I have been here over 5 years and still enjoy every aspect!
cons: Time! It’s always challenging with so much customer focus!

headline: Great company, products and people
pros: Fast paced environment with a team that has a customer and partner centric view of the business.   World class solutions for digital transformation that are top of mind for C-level Executives
cons: If you don't like a fast moving company, this isn't the place for you.

headline: First 3 weeks review as Software Development Engineer - Will update after few more months
pros:
* Good company culture - More of a startup culture
*All the engineers seems to be focused on their jobs
*Friendly colleagues
*Their cloud security as Service, is designed in an intelligent way. There is a good market in this area.
cons: *A new employee will find it difficult to get the resource he needs as the training documentation/videos is not that great.

headline: An inspirational company to achieve your aspirations
pros: Market leader, fantastic value proposition, good incentives and salary, internal promotions are encouraged
cons: I've been staring at my screen blankly for 10 minutes. I can't think of any worth emphasising...

headline: A match made in the clouds
pros: this company has world class technology and amazing teams and individuals. You have the opportunity to grow your personal development and be part of the evolution of the business. After being here several years, I'm the happiest I've been in my job. I have complete flexibility in my role and a great home/work balance. There is no where else I'd rather be.
cons: Nothing that you wouldn't find at any other company.

headline: Fantastic technology and world class benefits
pros: Technology, team, market, office and benefits all wonderful.
cons: Still very much a start-up mentality (you may like that)

headline: Culture
pros: Before joining Zscaler, I was at Microsoft for a number of years. Microsoft is well know for it’s culture, and how Satya turned the company around to make it as successful as it is today, so when it comes to a good culture, I have high expectations. When I started interviewing with Zscaler, I realised culture a huge part of the organisation, and something Jay led from the front. Since joining I have been blown away, it far exceeds Microsoft when it comes to a supportive, inclusive culture, this really is a place where everyone is invested in each other’s success, and the success of our customers. We re small enough to be agile and react fast, and that’s down to the mindset of the people who work here.
cons: With being a new company, who have only just gone IPO, it’s not as mature around some of the processes, but I actually like it. Microsoft was very heavy process orientated, but it needed to be, where a Zscaler isn’t, and I really like the empowerment of having the freedom that brings.

headline: Sales Engineer
pros: Great Culture, Fast paced. Fantastic product set. Good benefits
cons: No 401k Match,  Travel logistics a little conveluted

headline: Fantastic team with brilliant minds!!
pros: A team that really collaborates with the customer top of mind! Charging hard to execute a great solution!
cons: Hypergrowth has challenges and rewards.

headline: Senior Recruiter
pros: High Growth Company that is a leader in the Cloud Security space. Exciting technology, smart, driven people that strive to be the best day in and day out.
cons: With every company that is growing at the pace we are there are always growing pains...Be prepared to be challenged and have the ability to adapt and change quickly and you will succeed here.

headline: The Perfect Storm
pros: Fantastic  Culture driven by the leadership team. The best company I've worked for in a 20 + year career.   Zscaler has a very entrepreneurial and collaborative culture, it's a friendly and fun company to work for.   It's visionary and transformational approach to Security is exceptional , there  are very few solutions that come close.  The growth at Zscaler has been accelerated, it's now widely acknoweledged as being one of the most exciting Security vendors . Post IPO it continues to grow and looking forward to a very exciting future.  The leadership team are exceptional people who allow you flexibiity to get the job done, but will also support and provide guidance when you need help.
cons: I cannot think of any.

headline: For the winners among us
pros:
- Attractive solution, easy to sell
- Start - up that offers possibilities
- Potential
cons: Any negative experience, is disputable. Management is quite flexible.

headline: First week review
pros: Welcoming process was very comfortable. The staff makes it easy for someone new to settle in.
cons: Have not experienced any yet.

headline: First week review
pros: On-boarding  process is very good ,Amazing people and work atmosphere ,
cons: Not Applicable at this time

headline: Good Place to work
pros: Freedom to work, Learning, Self Drive
cons: Typical Startup ambiguities, Clarity of role definition and processes

headline: Fantastic Company and Technology
author_position: Manager, Global Service Providers and Systems Integrations (A/NZ)
pros: Great Team, and a visionary leader.  I've had the pleasure of working for many large and well know companies, but the Leadership Team at Zscaler are second-to-none!  As a business, we are streets ahead of the competition, and lead by a visionary who looks 10-years into the future of what it takes to be a successful company!
cons:
Nothing major!  As a newly listed business, we are still growing into our shoes, so-to-speak, and there is work to be done to align processes.
As an overseas employee, health insurance and car allowances are lower than industry standard.

headline: Excellent culture
pros: Excellent culture, friendly and team orientated. I feel that I am heard in discussions and that my opinion matters. Fantastic technology.
cons: I can't think of any cons at this point... which should tell you all you need to know!

headline: "Great Place to work"
pros:
Good learning opportunities for freshers
Exceptionally good peers to work with
Performance Appraisals for the hard work that you put in.
Good work life balance and compensation.
cons: None at this moment as per my opinion.

headline: Regional Sales Manager
pros: Great solution, sales team well funded, solid support from all departments, & lucrative ESPP offering
cons: no 401K match. As remote employee it is more challenging to develop relationships internally (but not different from other organizations)

headline: Review after one year
pros: great company with a very very good product. Management is also one of the best I had so far especially in Germany. working like an entrepreneur but if you need help you will get it up to the top management
cons: no complaints up to now

headline: System Engineer
pros:
Zscaler is a startup with an innovative solutions offers and a rapid growth on the market.
Internally, Zscaler is dynamic company with a rich technical environment, a strong management and a very positive environment.
cons: I did not find yet.

headline: great company to make a career
pros:
+ top leadership
+ humble and humane CEO
+ Frugal, but if you are good you get paid well. If you are average then you wont be paid great
+ Long term engineers and product managers (founding team, core engineers, couple of Product management leaders who are here 5+ years) are very smart people.
+ Customers love it, hard to find an unhappy customer
+ Lawsuits are just desperate attempts by competitors who simply can not outclass Zscaler's technology
cons:
- Politics (some teams) and within leadership (Execs with egos). 
- Recent engineering and product leadership hiring is mediocre in last 2-3 years. This is biggest con in my opinion.
- Expected churn in September

headline: Pivotal
pros: Amazing perks such as breakfast and refreshments
cons: Poor account allocation and an inability to recognise change is needed.

headline: Sr. Sales Engineer
pros: Excellent team, amazing solution, great benefits, and fantastic working environment!
cons: Typical growing pains for a pre-IPO (at the time) company.  Executive management needed to let go and focus on the direction of the company and not be involved in day-to-day field level decisions.  This has likely improved in the last year and especially since the IPO.

headline: Great place to work
pros:
- Work from Home
- Great Leadership
cons:
- Communication from X-Functional teams needs work
- More focus in-depth training is needed for support staff
- Work life balance

headline: Zscaler Japan
pros: Leadership with clear visions.  Major growth opportunity.
cons: Miscellaneous tasks due to lack of resources.

headline: Challenging but ultimately very rewarding!
pros: Great, ever evolving, technology along with the best sales engineering team I have ever worked with.
cons: Not a "con" as far as I'm concerned, but might be for some.  This is NOT a work 40 hours a week and go about your own business job.  If that is what you are looking for, look elsewhere.  You have flexibility in how you go about getting your job done, but ultimately the work needs to get done.

headline: I feel like an owner in the company!
pros: Fantastic company with creative leadership that is driven, innovative, and willing to change directions when needed.  This company is still run like a healthy start-up where maintaining and engaging culture is something the company strives to achieve.  World class technology coupled with a leadership team that is focused on the long-term and achievements.  One of the only places I have been that encourages you to hire above your own abilities.  Work hard, play hard, and keep things in perspective - culture.
cons: This company runs lean and operationally efficient.  You need to be willing to wear a lot of hats and do more than you might expect.  If you are unable to deal with ambiguity and rely too heavily on large amounts of support resources, this is not the place for you.

headline: Great team to be on
pros: Superb combination of exceptional team, product, and market. High integrity environment, and strong sense of community and giving back. Fun work hard, play hard culture.
cons: Frugality can be a bit much. Great for shareholder value, a bit of drag for employees, especially if your role calls for extensive travel.

headline: Great decision to start working here so far
pros:
Young exciting company
Great culture
Many career opportunities due to big growth
No other vendor on level of offered Saas for now.
cons: growing fast, opportunities but also some grow pains.

headline: Best Company I've Worked For
pros:
Amazing technology
Incredibly smart people
Strong trust in the exec team
Inclusive workplace
Employee Stock Purchase Program 
Freedom to pursue career goals
cons:
No 401k match
Skimpy PTO policy 
Hard for some departments to take "real" vacations and disconnect

headline: Great place to work
pros: Challenging and fast paced work environment.  Being on the bleeding edge of a major shift in Cloud Security transformation.
cons: It's not for everyone.  You will be challenged here and it takes an entrepreneurial spirit and work ethic to truly thrive.

headline: My first 100 days have been a blast.
pros: An incredible start to my time at Zscaler including the buzz of the IPO.   An incredible team.  Passionate, skilled, fun, focused, driven team from the CEO to the receptionist.   A company that truely has a vibe to be proud of and one that out customer genuinely love.  A company that delivers on all aspects and technically does exactly what it says on the tin (except as it's in the cloud, there is not tin!).   In my 27 + years of sales, this is THE place I was looking for.
cons: Really not aware of any yet.  Would love a bigger basic obviously, but the commission is great.  Not being able to take leave at quarters end is a pain, but very logical.

headline: Awesome company
pros: Good salary in Chandigarh region and best work-life balance
cons: Technologies which you work upon are bit outdated compared to current industry.

headline: Review for SDE role
pros: If you are lucky and not a fresher then you can get some good work.

headline: Great vision and execution
pros: The company has a great culture with lots of passion and gets things done. The technology is simply amazing. Customers really resonate with the message and the platform delivers what it says.
cons: No cons, can't think of any

headline: Great company, great Management and great Support
pros: The Management knows what the doing, clear strategy, lots of ressources that support you
cons: No cons at all, we need more people

headline: Sales at Zscaler
pros: Fast growing, very dynamic company. Very direct communication streams - no issue to send an email to the CEO directly if necessary. Agile Executive team, C-level Execs are in Europe for customer meetings every month. Good team in CEUR, great colleagues, everybody is supportive and responsive.
cons: Some processes still need to be established or improved. More responsibilities on EMEA level are needed, some things take to long if they need to be managed at HQ. But from my perspective that's just a matter of time and growth.

headline: A Company Built on Values
pros: Core values that are foundation for Zscaler which make it a strong business include, Customer first attitude, Cutting edge technology and Value for available resources. These factors ensured that it transformed from a small private company to a NASDAQ listed public company.
cons: Can't think of any !!

headline: Still enthousiastic after all those years
pros:
Zscaler provides a challenging but also fair and rewarding workplace. 
I love that the work is both technical and commercial which allows us to build a relationship with customers based on trust instead of FUD.
cons: US companies don't understand the European concept of holidays, but I've always been able to work things out agreeably.

headline: Good company to work for in cloud security
pros: Opportunities for self learning, new challenges, good exposure of cloud security & proxy.  if you spend sometime in company and prove yourself you will get promotions and movements to desired team to progress in career.
cons: Sometimes its struggle to get information internally as only few people are aware of what the change is all about and not everyone is aware due to work in different timezone.  not good chairs in office to sit on (may be office change next month will help).

headline: Zscaler, the best in Cloud Security
pros: Great disruptive technology. Still short lines and direct access to the CxO people.
cons: We grow very fast. Let's keep up the good spirit.

headline: RSM
pros: The people here are driven and talented
cons: There are often changes in eadership

headline: Cloud is the way of the future
pros:
Executive leadership is always willing to help.
Marketing team in phenomenal.
 IPO in March 2018, helps build credibility.
Zscaler has taken a very complicated set of point solutions in a typical security service chain and simplified it. 
Peers are amazing and always willing to help.
Manager and directors are the best in the business. 
Channel team is strong.
cons: Some people would gripe about middle management but honestly they are awesome. The only con regarding middle management is that they are spread a little too thin. Personally love my boss but I sometimes worry he is working too hard. Hopefully they will invest in additional SEM head count in 2018.

headline: Great tech, great leadership
pros: Opportunity to succeed if you work hard. Customers grasp value proposition easily. Financial selling coupled with great tech should be a business savvy sales rep's dream.
cons: Finance can enact a windfall clause if you hit a grand-slam, controlling income. Most reps make their OTE through bonuses and spiffs but fall short of feeling good due to not making their large quotas.

headline: Shared goals and vision - and a product customers love
pros: Diverse backgrounds from both big and small companies, personal beliefs, etc. But the team is aligned around shared culture and vision.  When you go to ask a cross functional team for help they don't say NO but rather, "Sure! I was thinking. about the same thing and why not XYZ".   The solution is differentiated and has the potential to be the cloud version of what a Network should be (not just security).  Really smart people.
cons: There is a lot of work to do as a part of the growth.  We also measure ourselves and look to continually improve.  Hard to hide if you are not contributing to customer and zscaler success.
