Sales turnover, which some of the posts here talk about - is a thing of the past now - the head of sales has been with the company for four years, the heads of EMEA and channels have three or more years of tenure - where there was turnover was in North America sales, but that is now fixed - our head of Americas has been with us a year now and he is a total stud.  And we just hired a new head of sales ops away from VM Ware.
cons:
This is an Internet security infrastructure company - it might not sound as cool to your friends as the next Snapchat. 
If you are looking for a startup - this is not it - we are about to be 600 people - so this is a fast growing, already profitable mid-sized SaaS company on the way to an IPO.

headline: Career blunder
pros: I was able to learn about how the COMPETITION exceeds industry knowledge and vision.
cons:
Revolving leadership (new VP sales each year), revolving employees (sales and SE's) and executives.  No real security knowledge nor respect towards partners.  

They are trying to increase addressable market with solutions instead of investing in current solutions and internal talent.  

Comp plan is the worst in the industry while leadership takes deals to be paid as reps.

headline: Good Technology, excellent colleagues, learning
pros:
Technology
Good People around
Learning Opportunities
Work life balance fine with few exceptions
cons:
Average appraisal
benefits not comparable to other startups

headline: very good atmoshphere
pros:
a ladder to grow and evolve.
helpful seniors
a new sense of automation,almost everything is automated and standardized so a very small room for favoritism
cons:
limited authority to employees
monotonous workload
least challenges and adventure

headline: Product Manager
pros:
Typical startups have  a focused niche product that they are trying to solve.  Zscaler on the other hand is a platform offering many components in the DMZ (Security, Proxy, DNS, DLP ...)  as a distributed cloud. That means sky is the limit on where the company can go with product offerings. Great to be in PM here.
The customer base already has the biggest gold plated brands around the world.  ALL their Internet access goes through Zscaler. That makes it easy to introduce them to additional capabilities to be bought from Zscaler as well. They simply say sure.. and a subscription is turned on. I came from a large appliance company, where shipping new appliances for each new functionality (or more boxes because new functions slow it down) was a big hinderance to introducing new products and getting sales acceptance.
cons:
There's so much to do there's never enough time.
Zscaler needs to hire fast. 
I hate my commute on 237... welcome to the downside of a economic recovery.

headline: Amazing management team encourages great results
pros:
Most employees are very smart (I enjoy working with 90% of my co-workers).
Cloud-delivery model could dominate market share.
Proven success in industry.
It feels electric to be here - we are clearly a company on the move
cons: Very hard charging environment - be ready to work hard and play hard too.

headline: This one will go all the way! - Best Product I have ever had the opportunity to sell
pros: The sales story is disruptive and allows me to position a compelling security technology solution to Enterprises. Rarely do we fail to get the attention of the key decision makers. The team supporting sales success is killer smart and has provided the tools for sales success.
cons: You need to be passionate and enjoy the disruptive technology sell. It takes 3 months of patience to build the pipeline.

headline: Best Place to work with the best Security Solution in the Market
pros:
High educated, experienced and sophisticated people are working for Zscaler.
They all have both foot on the ground with a clear target.
No one  in the company gets ever tired proclaiming Zscaler´s world class state-of-the-art security solution.
cons:
Non cons Zscaler is driven into a golden Future
I love working for this company

headline: Late stage pre-IPO company that has managed to still keep the innovation, fun and excitement of a startup
pros: For a late-stage company with hundreds of employees the company still feels very flat (in a positive way). The entire exec team is very accessible. The CEO and Founder talks to everyone every day and never rejects a meeting. The company is not afraid to invest in smart ideas and people to keep their market lead. Truly game changing technology with a surprising amount of global/large enterprise adoption!
cons: Find ways to keep the passion and devotion while keeping a reasonable work/life balance. Work smarter not harder.

headline: Not a place to build a career.
pros: Technology is interesting but adoption is hit or miss. Enterprise customers are a good fit for the solution.
cons: Lack of direction, no sales leadership, POC process is so intrusive and forced upon prospects that they go silent. Mixed messages, is this a security play or a networking play.  Every year they turn over the sales team and expect a different result

headline: Unrealistic expectations for sales people and sales territory develpoment
pros: Is a disruptive technology for the security market place
cons: If you are a salesperson "think twice" about taking the offer.  Sales cycle is 6 to 12 months plus.  Look to starve until you can develop a pipe IF management allows you to develop the accounts...

headline: Horrible outdated technology
pros: Hard sale for every sale keeps the business going
cons: Hard nosed company, most support based in india.  Product is far from complete

headline: The company has that great start up vibe, buzzing...
pros: Good people, one vision which is powerful when you've just started with a new company. Everybody is driving towards the same goal.
cons: Lack of process which should be expected at a start up, don't be put off, it just means that you learn more about the company, not just your role!

headline: Early to say but looking very positive
pros:
Smart and friendly people
Very experienced CEO with multiple successful start ups
Have a real good strategy plan going forward
Have built a "real cloud"
cons:
Have had success in one area, having some challenges  expanding into adjacent areas
Some execution challenges in achieving a strategy which has risks but huge upsides
Willingness to take big risks has reduced, understandable but could do more

headline: Poor management. Somewhat interesting product. Mismatched work.
pros: Somewhat successful late-stage startup. Interesting product line with potential.
cons: Poor management. Disorganized. High turnover rate in all departments.

headline: Fun place to work!
pros:
Zscaler is booming, but has kept its start-up style. 

The most important thing for me, when choosing a company to work at is work/life balance and culture. Even the biggest salary won't make me move to a company where culture is horrible, and people miserable. Zscaler has met my "human" expectations:

- Here is one thing that surprised me when I joined Zscaler: Everyone is in a cube, even upper management. No privileges based on title, no casts. It makes the place more relax and upper management easy to approach.

- I consider myself very lucky to be able to work with very bright people like our CEO or our COO, who have accomplished grand projects throughout their career. I learn a lot from them. If it was in a bigger company, I would just have been a number and the CEO would not have even know who I am.

- By working at Zscaler, you can really make a difference. I know that my hard work is recognized and there won't be anyone who will try to take credit for my job.

- It is a fast paced environment, as you can expect in Start-ups. You can't hide behind your desk, like in bigger groups and get away with not doing your work. It's either you like this kind of challenges or not. I am getting better at what I do and capitalizing for a bright career.

- Very good and smart people work at Zscaler. There is a positive attitude. We have lots of informal fun events like wine tastings and baking contests or outside drinks. Co workers are friendly, there is less politics than in any other company I worked at.

- We can tell of good environment to work by very little details. Here is one: Like in any companies in the Bay Area, our kitchen is full of snacks and sodas, that employees can take for free. I am not a big fan of sodas and prefer sparkling water. I shared this with the person in charge of supplying beverages and the day after we got sparkling water for everyone to enjoy in the company. I know it's anecdotal, but to me, it tells that people care.

- Company has a lot of potential, product is innovative and technology is disruptive. I have no doubt that Zscaler will do very well.
cons:
The company start-up mentality. It can be good or it can be bad, based on how you look at it.

- You can work at a big organization and get away by doing minimal work. This is not the case at Zscaler, your work is very visible. It can be seen as a negative point for some people.

- Not everybody can work in start-up mode companies: close to zero politics, and people awarded based on hard work only.

headline: Once in a Lifetime Opportunity
pros: Zscaler offers ambitious, creative individuals the opportunity to be part of history in driving the company's disruptive direct-to-cloud network to overtake the stale, appliance-based model that dominates today's enterprise security space.  In just 5 years, Zscaler has achieved a $1B+ evaluation, leader status in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Secure Web Gateways, an enviable Fortune 500 customer base and a patent portfolio that will keep it in the innovation driver's seat for years to come.  At Zscaler you are given the resources and the opportunity that any self-starter would kill for.  Work hard, contribute to the culture and enjoy the ride.  This company will IPO in less than 18-24 months and since there is very little dilution, employee stakeholders won't get screwed post IPO like they do at so many other companies.
cons: Senior management has a low threshold for incompetence.  Don't come to work here unless you want to kick ass and be the best at what you do.  Low-achievers and slackers need not apply.

headline: Great Technology, Great people and exciting work environment
pros: Every day is different and everything you do makes a difference - it's great to see that your contribution makes the company succesful
cons: sometimes meetings are called during the evenings but working for a global company you expect this

headline: Innovative technology in a robust market with experienced management
pros:
Redefining enterprise technology and network optimization with Direct-to-Cloud Network.

Company is well-positioned for success in the robust security market.

Experienced management team remains accessible to advise employee growth.

Strong sense of camaraderie includes ice cream parties, BBQs, wine-tasting events and bake-off contests.

Free catered lunch every Thursday and plenty of drinks and snacks.
cons:
CEO Jay Chaudhry has a reputation for frugality, but has the best interests of the company at heart and is willing to invest in justified expenses.

Like any large or growing organization, strategic initiatives can quickly rise and fall, depending on any number of extenuating circumstances, which can give the illusion of chaos, but at the highest level that strategy is well-defined and well-executed.

headline: Great Technology
pros: One of the greatest technology to work on within their domain.
cons: Small company and Management is Money/Cost oriented.

headline: Great place to learn a lot
pros:
+ visionary technology  .... if you care to learn high speed and scalable networking technology then then there is a lot to learn here. The C10M problem, being talked about as the problem of next decade, is being tackled here for last 5 yrs
+ small teams, lots of opportunity to learn by working with some seriously talented & passionate people 
+ mgmt that listens and acts .. can tell certainly for engineering
+ zero politics
+ work-life balance is possible- this might not be a case 2-3 yrs ago when company was a budding starup, but now I do see many who are leading good balance, of course there are others in the other camp but lot of times it depends upon once's priorities and passion.
+ capable of change- i have seen company changing during my tenure (of < 3yrs) with more focus given to employee recognition, benefits, proper hr etc.
cons:
- a startup in rapid growth phase, many challenges yet to solve, depending upon your perspective this can be an opportunity
- very selective in hiring, as a result recruitment for experienced engineers is slow, sometimes resulting in short of resources for some teams
- competitive but not in top tier in terms of comp & benefits
- no ping pong table here in Bangalore :(

headline: Nice tech but luck of direction
pros: Nice tech, very good coworkers
cons: Luck of direction, assuming that you spend lots of extra hours min 10 a day, so no life. Not able to work remotely .

headline: prospective employees and customers stay away!
pros: was one of first to come out with this technology, but competitors have all but caught up
cons:
very bad culture/motivation within employees
stingy management
stock not worth much at all

headline: Good place with lot of potential
pros:
They are visionaries in their technology space and have a lot of potential. You will find an organization with: 
*  Very smart & incredibly hardworking people
* Amazing Product & Innovation
* Atmosphere of dedication 
* Very approachable upper management (CEO)
*  Place to be if you are straightforward, self-motivated & love technology
* Your ping-pong skills will improve 

Unlike larger companies where a lot of people end up taking credit for your hard work, Zscaler is very meritocratic. The CEO and Management are very clued-in on who's doing what and it is easy to shine here if you do good work. You will work with a very smart and driven group of people who share a common passion in making cloud security a reality. There is more emphasis on communication (monthly-all hands) and Thursday lunches are catered in to meet with folks.
cons:
When you are the first one in the space, the burden falls on you to validate all aspects of the technology and make it work. The team here continues to work through these challenges and you will need a optimistic can-do attitude to succeed here. If you are used to having efficient processes and procedures and a very structured approach to work, you may find yourself at sea. 

However, on the bright side, you can define these procedures. Likewise, do not let things fester and feel free to scream out to your manager as people here are very busy and may not have time for the mollycoddling and regular 1:1 available in larger companies.

headline: Great technology, but completely disorganized
pros:
- Impressive & innovative technology
- Lots of bright and intelligent people working there
cons:
- Training was disorganized, making the on-boarding process rocky
- Processes in general weren't thought through
- Growth opportunities not defined
- Inadequate pay
- Unattainable goals set with no solutions given to improve performance

headline: An ideal place to Work, Learn & Grow
pros: Zscaler is an organization where every employee has an important role to play in company's march towards success. Here you'll find people who have passion to learn and to work. I have been with Zscaler for over 4 years and seen this company build real cloud security technology and become the market leader. Which other company can claim protecting over 10 million users from 180 countries? If you are looking for some place where you can learn and get freedom to innovate, where you won't have to worry about petty politics, where you can implement your ideas and make them valuable for the company, Zscaler is the right place for you
cons: Not a good place to get ahead by playing politics and not delivering results. So, not everybody will be happy here :)

headline: Cool technology, cool company
pros: I joined Zscaler 5 years ago when it was a very small company in stealth mode and I have seen its growth. Its revolutionary technology is leaving competition in the dust and has helped it acquire some of the largest global brands. it has given me a great opportunity to learn and professionally grow.
cons: With rapid growth comes fast-pace work environment but I love that

headline: Shocking Attitude of a Hire and Fire Start-up
pros:
Good technology and story
Good customer base
cons:
Field sales not given enough time to develop local business - and are then fired!!!
Disgraceful support. Lack of respect given to existing customers.
Finding it very hard to retain existing customers - lots of time spent trying to get renewals.
Poor marketing messaging - still no proper solution for BYOD devices - when competition is catching up very fast.
Unreliable data centres - problems with GeoIP databases etc.

headline: Amazing Company to Work with
pros: Zscaler has been a turning point in my career. It is a great company to work with. Highly Professional people to work with and a great work environment. This company is certainly not a right place for people who are not passionate to excel. Senior Management promotes creativity and empowerment to it's employees.
cons: I have been working with Zscaler since last 2 years and do not see any cons of working with this company. All my "+" goes to this company.

headline: Right company, right product, right time
pros: While others have spoken about a detrimental work environment here at ZScaler, I couldn't disagree more. There is passion and excitement about what we are doing here. We do run at breakneck speed at times, however that is hardly the exclusive purview of ZScaler in Silicon Valley. While I am asked to produce, the support and encouragement is there and I don't feel that the environment prevents me from being successful.
cons: You can work at a Cisco or other large companies and get by with minimal effort. That isn't the case here. If people see that as a negative than this isn't the place for them.

headline: Unorganized, chaotic
pros: Lots of smart, bright people. Decent business idea. A growing business.
cons: High turnover, lots of fighting, lack of management

headline: Hot Technology Startup with a Team Having a Proven Track Record
pros:
Very cool technology - scalable, high-peformance cloud security solution.
Good market traction and rapidly growing customer base.
Lots of talented engineers with strong engineering leadership.
CEO has a proven track record for funding and leading several companies.
Stock is not diluted with lots of rounds of VC funding rounds.
cons:
Very aggressive work culture - not for the faint hearted.
Sink or swim attitude has caused a few burnouts.
Benefits and vacations are paltry.
